Tay et al. synthesised and evaluated N-[4-(benzothiazole-2yl) phenyl]-2-aryloxyacetamide derivatives for cytotoxicity and anticancer activity against sixty human cancer cell lines derived from 9 neoplastic diseases, among which L (leukaemia), M (melanoma), RC (renal cancer) NSCLC (non-small cell lung cancer) CC (colon cancer), OC (ovar ian cancer), BC (breast cancer), CNSC (central nervous system cancer) and PC (prostate cancer). Derivatives 49 ( N-(4-(benzo[d]thiazol-2-yl)-3-methoxyphenyl)-3–(4-chlorophenyl)propanamide) and 50 ( N-(4-(benzo[d]thiazol-2-yl)-2-chlorophenyl)-2–(4-chlorophenylthio)acetamide) ( Figure 30) exhibited interesting anti-cancer activities. The SAR studies investigated that anticancer activities of these compounds were due to the substitutions (methoxy and chloro groups) present in their molecules
51 .
